Greetings player and thank you for trying Taps of Fire!

Let me provide you a minimum information to start playing immediately.

This game actually is very similar to Guitar Hero (R) and other rhythm-based games, you need to pick up notes as they come to the bottom of the screen along with music.

The following tutorial explains gameplay in detail. Tap an image for the next frame.
There are three strings and three corresponding keys...
When note comes down tap appropriate key. For convenience tap zones are twice as tall as keys.
Holding key while note passes gets you more scores.
When two adjacent notes come down things get a little tricky...
It this case you need to tap between the keys.
What about situation when green+yellow or all three notes come down?
In this case you need to tap middle key. Red, green+yellow, and all three notes are picked using red key.

"ToF was programmed by Dmitry Skiba.
It is an open source project hosted at
http://code.google.com/p/tapsoffire"

In fact ToF is an Android's reimplementation of an excellent open source game Frets on Fire and uses it's data files.

Songs are by Sectoid and -API-.

Other stuff: Seaweed Fire AOE font by Astigmatic One Eye, Seriffic Grunge font by Eric Perlin.

Because ToF originated from Frets on Fire, it understands it\'s songs. There are plenty of them on the Internet. Just google for \'FOF songname\', for example \'FOF Sonic Clang\'. After you get songs put them on the sdcard in TapsOfFire/songs folder, and they are ready to play!

ToF\'s gameplay is much like all other rhythm-based games: song is playing, notes are coming. And your goal is to pick them.\nThe following interactive tutorial illustrates gameplay. Click an image to get to the next frame.

As you may have noticed ToF does not support landscape orientation. This is primarily because it\'s hard to play in that mode. The second reason is that I didn\'t have enough time to properly investigate it. Maybe support for landspace mode will appear in next versions.

In case you wonder why Settings screen is not fullscreen, that is because in fullscreen mode soft keyboard overlaps controls which are at the bottom of the view. This behaviour seems to be by design, so some kind of hacking and tweaking were needed. Unfortunately I didn\'t have time for that.
You may tweak picking rules and other parts of program behavior in Advanced settings. To get there press MENU key in Settings screen.

Note about caching. ToF uses folder /sdcard/TapsOfFire/cache for caching. Bundled songs and uncompressed music files are stored there. There is a setting, called \'cache length\' which limits number of entries in the cache. You can tweak it on advanced settings page.
